awd_titl_txt: CICI: RSARC: SECTOR: Building a Secure and Compliant Cyberinfrastructure for Translational Research
awd_abstract_narration:
Translational research has been driven by the increasing amount of heterogeneous data sets collected from medical instruments, sensors, patient diagnosis records, genomic and microbiome samples. The recent advancement in information technology greatly accelerates the innovation in translational research by applying in-depth analysis on these data with large scale computing and storage resources. Clinical researchers now heavily rely on such cyberinfrastructure to understand trends, derive correlations, and/or identify anomalies, which are instrumental to accurate diagnosis, precision drug discovery and effective treatment of diseases.  In this context, the security of the patient data, the efficient sharing of data, and the processing of data in a regulation compliant fashion are critical. This project addresses the resource limitations and security aspects of data-driven translational research. The project will greatly speed up clinical research activities that rely heavily on the analysis of sensitive data. The resulting software defined security infrastructure can be applied to a wide range of cyberinfrastructure that carries sensitive data. The project will strengthen the collaboration among computer scientists, clinical researchers, IT managers and provides a rare opportunity to address the cyberinfrastructure challenges in a holistic way instead of an ad hoc, incremental manner.

This project designs and deploys a Security and compliant Cyberinfrastructure for Translational Research (SECTOR) that enables sharing and computing on sensitive data sets between private compute clusters, a shared HPC facility and/or a HIPAA compliant cloud. Specifically, it (1) leverages the emerging software defined infrastructure (SDI), blockchain and secure domain name system to extend the boundary of computing on sensitive and private data. This is the first project to bring the agility and resilience of SDI to clinical research activities; (2) designs a framework that enables the deployment of a new workflows with fine grained user and access control that are compliant with the HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996) technical safeguard; (3) enables the migration of data computation using streaming based data redirection and processing, requiring very little effort in porting existing scientific applications; (4) designs a portal that exploits the underlying SDI resources to help various stakeholders to express their workflow and simplify the management of healthcare resources.

por.por_cntn:
The objective of the SECTOR project is designing and deploying a novel resilient SEcure and compliant Cyberinfrastructure for TranslatiOnal Research that enables sharing and computing on sensitive data among private compute clusters, the shared HPC facility and/or HIPAA compliant cloud. 

 

We leveraged the emerging software defined infrastructure, blockchain to extend the boundary of computing on sensitive and private data. During the course of the project, we conceptualized and designed a framework to enable new workflows with fine-grained user and access control that are compliant with the HIPAA technical safeguard. The designed prototype consists of a portal that exploits the underlying SDI resources to help various stakeholders to express their workflow and simplify the management of the healthcare resources. 

 

Medical data are generated at different healthcare institutions and scattered geographically, yet at an increasing pace they need to be shared to facilitate cross-institution collaboration and enable clinical research. It has been a challenge to share data efficiently while meeting regulatory compliance. While many file transfer services exist, none have achieved the various objects of sharing sensitive data with guaranteed security audit and ease of use. Through SECTOR project, we created a data sharing service specifically designed for medical data, leveraging Hyperledger block-chain to record data transactions and Globus for secure file transfers. By separating control substrate and data substrate, SECTOR stores on a distributed ledger the data operations and supports flexible data storage and transfer backend. We use smart contract to implement business logic of cross-institution EMR management and provide immutable audit trails per compliance requirements. We also added additional features such as task management to facilitate data sharing project creation, resource allocation and fine-grained access control. The prototype demonstrates the effectiveness in a number of clinical use cases. 

 

The project has also provided many opportunities for training the students on the state of art technology and real-world data sharing challenges. By working with experts in the medical clinic research and cyberinfrastructure professionals in medical schools, the participating postdocs, graduate students and undergraduate gained rare opportunity to understand the challenges and search for solutions that are technologically capable and practically feasible and compliant. The project enriched the participants? knowledge in computing, networking and machine learning, cultivated their verbal and written communication skills, and taught them the importance of critical thinking and innovation.
